formatDescription: When a previously saved Word document is opened for editing, for printing, or for review, Word creates a temporary file that has a .doc file name extension. This file name extension begins with a tilde (~) that is followed by a dollar sign ($) that is followed by the remainder of the original file name. This temporary file holds the logon name of person who opens the file. This temporary file is called the "owner file."
provenanceCompoundName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

internalSignatures.name: MS Owner file v1
internalSignatures.note: 1st byte is within the range of 06 to 0F. Next bytes are name of registered user. 55th byte is identical to 1st. 56th byte is 00
